eu.ebdit.duckapter
Class Duckapter

java.lang.Object
  eu.ebdit.duckapter.Duckapter

public class Duckapter
extends java.lang.Object

Duckapter brings support for duck typing into the java programming language.
Duckapter has two methods canAdaptInstance(Object, Class) and canAdaptClass(Class, Class) for finding out whether particular class or instance can be "duck typed" or adapted to the given interface. And two methods adaptClass(Class, Class) and adaptInstance(Object, Class) which performs the adaptation to the interface.
Methods canAdaptInstance(Object, Class) and adaptInstance(Object, Class) can adapt existing objects. Methods canAdaptClass(Class, Class) and adaptInstance(Object, Class) adapts class object to access static methods and properties but also constructors.

Author:
vladimir.orany

Constructor Detail

Duckapter

public Duckapter()
Method Detail

adaptInstance

public static <T> T adaptInstance(java.lang.Object original,
                                  java.lang.Class<T> duck)
Tries to adapt existing instance to the interface given as duck.
duck interface can be any interface. This means that duck interface can also has methods annotated with Static, Factory and Constructor, but its usually better to keep this methods separately.
original must implement all demanded methods and properties to satisfy canAdaptInstance(Object, Class) method.
If duck interface has Optional methods they will throw UnsupportedOperationException when called but not implemented for given instance.
Both parameters must not be null.

Type Parameters:
T - interface to be adapted to and returned
Parameters:
original - instance to be adapted to specified duck interface
class - of duck interface to be adapted to and returned. Must be an interface.
Returns:
original instance adapted to given duck interface which also implements Adapted interface
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if canAdaptInstance(Object, Class) returns false for given parameters

adaptClass

public static <T> T adaptClass(java.lang.Class<?> original,
                               java.lang.Class<T> duckInterface)
Tries to adapt class to the interface given as duck. duck interface must have only methods annotated with Static, Factory and Constructor which are supposed to be access on the class level. original class must have all this method to satisfy canAdaptClass(Class, Class) method.
If duck interface has Optional methods they will throw UnsupportedOperationException when called but not implemented for given class. All return types of duckInterface must be same as on original or must be also able to be adapted.
Both parameters must not be null.

Type Parameters:
T - interface to be adapted to and returned
Parameters:
original - original class to be adapted to specified duck interface
duckInterface - class of duck interface to be adapted and returned. Must be an interface.
Returns:
proxy instance mapping constructors, static methods and properties to the given duck interface and which also implements Adapted interface
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if canAdaptClass(Class, Class) returns false for given parameters

canAdaptClass

public static boolean canAdaptClass(java.lang.Class<?> original,
                                    java.lang.Class<?> duckInterface)
Determines whether particular class can be adapted to the given interface. All methods of duckInterface must be annotated with Static, Factory or Constructor or the interface itself must be annotated with Static.
duckInterface must be an interface.
All methods not declared as Optional must be implemented by original class.
All return types of duckInterface must be same as on original or must be also able to be adapted.

Parameters:
original - class we want to determine whether is adaptable for given duckInterface
duckInterface - interface we want to determine whether original class can be adapted to
Returns:
true if duckInterface is an interface and all methods not declared as Optional are implemented by original class

canAdaptInstance

public static boolean canAdaptInstance(java.lang.Object original,
                                       java.lang.Class<?> duckInterface)
Determines whether particular instance can be adapted to the given interface.
duckInterface must be an interface.
All methods not declared as Optional must be implemented by original instance.

Parameters:
original - instance we want to determine whether is adaptable for given duckInterface
duckInterface - interface we want to determine whether original instance can be adapted to
Returns:
true if duckInterface is an interface and all methods not declared as Optional are implemented by original instance
